N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 81.2 - Legal base

State Regulations
(a) The Mental

Hygiene Law, section 13.01, prohibits any individual, association, corporation
or public or private agency from operating a residential facility, school or
institution for the examination, diagnosis, care, treatment, rehabilitation or
training of persons with mental disabilities including mental retardation
unless an operating certificate has been obtained from the Commissioner of

Mental Hygiene. Sections 13.07, 13.09, 13.13 and 13.19 further authorize the
commissioner or his representatives to examine and inspect such facilities to
determine their suitability and proper operation. Sections 13.15 and 13.17
authorize the commissioner to suspend, revoke or limit any operating
certificate. (b) The Mental Hygiene

Law, section 13.03, empowers the commissioner to adopt regulations pertaining
to the regulation and quality control of services for the mentally disabled, as
he may deem necessary to carry out the provisions of article 13 of the Mental

Hygiene Law. Notes
